    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }

          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {

            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<span class="line"><!---->Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<span class="line"><!---->Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again.       <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, May 25, 2021, 5:54 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>

          (was: Assigned)

          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<span class="line"><!---->Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1212733: Security: expat vulnerable to CVE-2013-0340?
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1212733: Security: expat vulnerable to CVE-2013-0340?
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 1:28 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

        Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<span class="line"><!---->Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      bunge...@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1106197033" title="bunge...@chromium.org"><!---->bunge...@chromium.org<!----></a>
      bunge...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->bunge...@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<span class="line"><!---->Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>
      
      
      
        
          Comment 7<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c7">Comment 7<!----></a>

          
        by

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues<!----></a> Impact guidelines: <span class="line"><!----> Impact guidelines: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security<!----></a> Thanks for your time! <span class="line"><!----> Thanks for your time! <!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, May 25, 2021, 5:54 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<span class="line"><!---->Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        Thanks! Adjusting Impact to mark the earliest affected branch (i.e. forever) but severity sounds good. If it's denial of service technically it's not a security bug at all according to Chrome guidelines, but as it's got a CVE we'll keep it in the security queue to reduce confusion.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! Adjusting Impact to mark the earliest affected branch (i.e. forever) but severity sounds good. If it's denial of service technically it's not a security bug at all according to Chrome guidelines, but as it's got a CVE we'll keep it in the security queue to reduce confusion.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.             Issue 1212733: Security: expat vulnerable to CVE-2013-0340?
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1212733: Security: expat vulnerable to CVE-2013-0340?
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      adetaylor@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/2705528455" title="adetaylor@google.com"><!---->adetaylor@google.com<!----></a>
      adetaylor@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->adetaylor@google.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Mon, May 24, 2021, 12:59 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 12:59 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
            
              Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
          <small class="byline">

        Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<span class="line"><!---->Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">

          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>

        Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<span class="line"><!---->Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you!       <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, May 25, 2021, 5:54 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<span class="line"><!---->Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Thanks! Adjusting Impact to mark the earliest affected branch (i.e. forever) but severity sounds good. If it's denial of service technically it's not a security bug at all according to Chrome guidelines, but as it's got a CVE we'll keep it in the security queue to reduce confusion.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! Adjusting Impact to mark the earliest affected branch (i.e. forever) but severity sounds good. If it's denial of service technically it's not a security bug at all according to Chrome guidelines, but as it's got a CVE we'll keep it in the security queue to reduce confusion.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          background-color: var(--chops-white);

          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          margin: 0;

          margin-top: 1em;

        }

        }
      </style>

        Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<span class="line"><!---->Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          Comment 6<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      bunge...@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/1106197033" title="bunge...@chromium.org"><!---->bunge...@chromium.org<!----></a>
      bunge...@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->bunge...@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<span class="line"><!---->Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <span class="line"><!---->) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again. Thank you! Severity guidelines: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/security/severity-guidelines.md#severity-guidelines-for-security-issues<!----></a> Impact guidelines: <span class="line"><!----> Impact guidelines: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/docs/security/security-labels.md#labels-relevant-for-any-type_bug_security<!----></a> Thanks for your time! <span class="line"><!----> Thanks for your time! <!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<span class="line"><!---->Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        Thanks! Adjusting Impact to mark the earliest affected branch (i.e. forever) but severity sounds good. If it's denial of service technically it's not a security bug at all according to Chrome guidelines, but as it's got a CVE we'll keep it in the security queue to reduce confusion.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks! Adjusting Impact to mark the earliest affected branch (i.e. forever) but severity sounds good. If it's denial of service technically it's not a security bug at all according to Chrome guidelines, but as it's got a CVE we'll keep it in the security queue to reduce confusion.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<span class="line"><!---->Every user of expat (afaik) uses XML_SetEntityDeclHandler to simply halt parsing (as invalid) on any xml entity expansion. It's like step three of any expat use. Good to see that they're mitigating upstream though. Should probably pick that up.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c6">Comment 6<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Mon, May 24, 2021, 2:01 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<span class="line"><!---->Well, at least, I thought it was well known to always set XML_SetEntityDeclHandler and disable entity expansion when using expat. However, outside of Skia I don't see any code actually doing so. So it looks like libjingle_xmpp, the parser in the wayland support code, and the one fontconfig could be vulnerable to this. The fontconfig and wayland parsers appear to be only using xml from the system, so it would only be someone DoS'ing themselves. Not sure about libjingle though. Note that there are two more uses, one in perl and one in libprotobuf-mutator, but these don't appear to ship.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<span class="line"><!---->Dear owner, thanks for fixing this bug. We’ve reopened it because security bugs need Security_Severity and Security_Impact labels set, which will enable the bots to request merges to the correct branches ( as well as helping out our vulnerability reward and CVE processes). Please consult with any Chrome security contact (<!----></span>security@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/security@chromium.org"><!---->security@chromium.org<!----></a>) to arrange to set these labels and then this bug can be marked closed again.       <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c10">Comment 10<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Tue, May 25, 2021, 5:54 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>

          (was: Assigned)

          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Fixed
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          Security_Severity-Low Security_Impact-Head OS-Android OS-Linux OS-Mac OS-Windows OS-Lacros
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<span class="line"><!---->Of the shipping users of expat in Chromium, the only one I can find that seems could be impacted by this is libjingle. From a cursory glance it looks like this may be involved in XMPP, though I haven't looked too hard. It does seem that an attacker could send an XMPP request which could cause a tab in the recipient (who would already need to be connected to the attacker) to crash when it runs into memory limits, but is limited to this sort of DoS. Someone from the security team could take a closer look and verify if they so wish (and change the Security_Severity label as appropriate), but this has been a generally known thing for the past eight years now so doesn't seem overly urgent.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 11<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1212733#c11">Comment 11<!----></a>

          
        by

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

 window.getTSMonClient().recordIssueDetailSpaTiming();
 });

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
